attributes.action: Fairer pay for band 2 clinical support workers
attributes.additional_details: We would like the government to consider moving all band 2s especially those in acute areas up to band 3. We would also like the fact that second year nursing students have been offered this pay to be considered. despite the fact that many clinical support workers have dedicated years to the NHS and offer a much higher skill rate they are being disregarded. Clinical support workers are currently paid at the same rate as many other members of staff who do not have half as much responsibility.
attributes.background: Reconsider the pay scale for clinical support workers in the NHS, Band 2 are currently some of the hardest working and most frontline staff. Pay scale and banding does not reflect the importance and value of their role.

rejection.details:
In your area the grading of certain groups of staff, and the setting of their responsibilities, are matters for NHS Scotland and the relevant trade unions, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You may wish to sign these petitions instead:

Increase pay for NHS healthcare workers and recognise their work: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300073  

 

Give NHS staff a one off bonus for their help with Covid 19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/321150 

 

Reward our healthcare heroes now for risking their lives to fight Covid-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318741 

 

Give NHS staff a pay rise in line with MPs pay increase: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/313513 

 

Pay all NHS Staff at least the Real Living Wage: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310615 

 

Incentivise NHS staff during the COVID19 outbreak by making wages untaxable: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/304595 

 

Increase National Insurance by 5 pence to Increase Salaries for all NHS Workers: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310518 

 

Award all nursing staff in the NHS pay rise of 10%: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/316307
